page.title: 06FARMING 2.ANIMALS
page.content: Dairy farming is most important to the economy of the area and even farms that do not have a dairy herd often keep two or three cows that provide the family with milk butter and clotted cream although the regulations on 'untreated' milk products are being tightened this autumn - not a very popular restriction. Apart from dairy cows, rearing of store cattle, sheep, pigs and poultry are all undertaken and there is even a small breeding herd of deer on one of the farms. There is a veterinary surgeon with a practice in the block who is able to undertake the care of animals on the surrounding farms. Animals can be grazed out in the fields for most of the year but cattle are often housed in the winter and sheep, particularly around lambing are brought indoors. Animals are sold at local markets.
